name: Grand Palladium Kantenah Resort and Spa

reviews.title: Amazing Resort
reviews.text: My husband, Brian (32) and I (30) recently returned from vacationing at the Palladium from May 7-14, 2005. We went with Brian's brother, Rick (35) and his girlfriend, Carrie (23). They had never been to an all inclusive resort and they loved it. This was our second time to the Riviera Maya and we will definately go back. The first time we stayed at the Moon Palace, which is much closer to the airport than the Palladium.

reviews.title: Had a great time, not a regret.
reviews.text: Here are my thoughts on the vacation. Hopefully, they will be useful to you as you plan your trip.

reviews.title: Overall it was OK
reviews.text: We booked our trip through Apple Vacations. Our plane left on time at 7am on the 7th. We arrived in Cancun a little early, but it too about an hour for us to get through customs/immigration. We were dircted to the Apple bus that took us to our hotel. We had to make several drop offs along the way, so we didn't get to the Palladium until 12:30. Check in was quick, but our room wasn't going to ready until 2:30. Rick and Carrie we able to get into their room right away. They had a regular room with a King bed on the Collonial Side. They said the construction was noticable, but not overly annoying. We booked a Mayan Suite with a King bed, but we ended up with two double beds for some reason. It wasn't a big deal though. We were right on the beach on the Kentanah side and it was wonderful.

The first day was hectic because the resort is enormous. We decided to eat lunch at the Main restaurant, which is by the pool. The buffet was complete chaos, but the food selection and quality was very good. We vowed never to eat there again because it was a madhouse, but we went back later that week and it was perfectly fine. I think the first day of vacation is so overwhelming because there is so much to do. We decided to book our 3 ala cart dinners right away. This is important to do right away because they book up fast. The steak house was the best. We also ate at the Mexican restaurant, which was great and the Mediterranean, which was ok. The cheesecake wasn't that good, FYI.
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Colonial Palladium Resort & Spa
Excellent
reviews.text: The pools are amazing. We liked the spa pool a lot because it was quiet and there was a bar right there. The main pool has a swim up bar, which is fun. The frozen drinks are all very sweet. My favorite is the dirty banana, or sexy banana - it was yummy. I wasn't a big fan of the magaritas because the lime juice was way to sweet. The wine is good and the beer is delicious. BRING insulated mugs, if you don't you'll be sorry!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was my wife and my self’s first stay at an all inclusive resort. We traveled from May 18-24. It was also our first stay in Mexico except for a cruise excursion for a few hours in Cozumel. Overall, I would say we are sort of undecided about returning simply because we don't have a basis for comparison. I think we would probably try another resort first and maybe even another vacation destination. Except for a few things, I agree with everything positive you have read about the resort. It is huge and beautiful. The staff was excellent. Drinks were very good. The pools and beach were great. I don't want to repeat all of these things and don’t have anything positive and new to add but do want to tell you what discourages us from returning. (This may be long but I hope it helps.)
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel but Would Probably Try Another If I Return

reviews.text: Check In- As suggested on reviews, we made a request to the hotel for a Mayan Suite on the Kantenah side, on the top floor, and a King bed. We said the most important feature be the top floor. We made a request about a month before, then again the week we left. When we arrived we found none of our requests had been granted. We got a Mayan Suite on the Colonial side, two double beds, and the first floor. I know they can't always accommodate all requests but at least part of the request would have been nice. We were not whisked away on a golf cart. We were escorted to our room with a bellboy and our bags. He said it would be better for us to do this so we could get to know our way around the grounds. But, he made a couple of wrong turns himself and got us lost for a minute!
reviews.title: GREAT RESORT and Honest Review.
Perfect Beach!!
reviews.text: The Room- The Mayan Suites are overall pretty awesome. However, you do not want to get the one we did. It was in building 31. There was a busy walkway about 10 feet in front of our balcony. You could also see the new construction plain as day right in front of our balcony about 150 yards away. There was no privacy of any kind. When we walked in and were checking out the room, we looked out the window past the balcony and there was a security guard standing on the walkway outside staring inside our room at us. Very strange set up. The Mayan shower outside on the balcony was private from by passers, however, the people on the second floor can look over their balcony into your shower!!! If you think you can take an au natural shower without someone seeing your "privates", think again. It is NOT A PRIVATE SHOWER. At check in we were told we could change rooms later in the week to meet our accommodation requests. We told them that our given room would be fine, but after seeing the things mentioned above, we called them back and asked to be moved. Our third day there we were moved to building 31. Still on the Colonial side and two double beds but on the second floor. We enjoyed this much more. These outdoor showers are not as nice as the first floor pictures which you see on the website. They aren't as big and do not have the plants growing around them but at least they were private. The construction noise was not bad at all and we could actually see it going on above the trees about 300 yards away. The inside of the rooms however were noisy. There were always these weird sounds coming from the walls/other rooms. I don't know what it was. It sounded like loud "clanks" and another noise that was like heavy furniture being dragged across the floor. A sort of screeching sound. It kept me awake a lot.

The Food- This is the one thing I disagree most about over the majority of reviews I have read. The ala-cartes were pretty good. We had a Japanese show table and the steak house. Service and presentation were nice. The buffets were not very good at all. Breakfast was OK. Dinner seemed like the same old things every night even though there were different themes. Just chicken and beef in the same sauces simmering in chaffing dishes. The wait for the grill at dinner and omelet station for breakfast was long at times. Service here was hit or miss and we did tip for everything. We made a reservation for the beach BBQ but it was cancelled (because there was a brief shower an hour before it was supposed to start) so we had to eat at the buffet from Wednesday evening when we arrived until our first ala-carte Saturday night. For lunch, there was no indoor AC dining option. There was the buffet by the pool and the beach bar. Personally, I have to eat indoors when it is that hot. I have no appetite after being in the hot sun all day unless I can cool off. It also presented the last and final problem. Flies. There were more flies at this resort than anywhere I have ever been and I am from the Southeast where they are bad. The food at the pool buffet was covered in them. I don't see how anyone can swat flies away from a stack of burgers, then pick one up and plop it on their plate to eat. I normally only got the ice cream from the machine so I could be sure it hadn't been "Flied" on. Another option was the beach bar. They also have a small buffet that is outdoors, but the food is at least covered on the chaffing dishes. You can get burgers, hot dogs, nachos, and quesadillas. Also you can get made to order tacos which were very good. Still, you are eating in 90+ degree heat constantly swatting flies from your food and drink. I was under the impression that one of the air conditioned buffets was open for lunch, but this was not the case.
reviews.title: Superb Family Get Away

reviews.text: I know I've ripped the place pretty good, but I just want everyone to know the negative things we experienced in detail to help make whatever trip you take as good as possible. Again, we had a pretty good trip overall. We were just a little disappointed after reading a lot of positive reviews. I thought I would be overwhelmed because we are not picky people at all. I enjoy the Golden Corral buffet at home! Like I said, this was our first trip to this area. I don't know if the flies are a problem everywhere or if it was because the jungle setting the resort is in. The biggest problem for me is that I hardly had anything to eat on an all-inclusive vacation.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, Not One Complaint!
Great Honeymoon. Fantastic time!
reviews.text: We began Searching for the perfect location in May 2004 and by November we had finally finalized that the Grand Palladium would be a amazing Resort to great Married. I Contacted our local travel agent who was very helpful in getting everything started. I also began emailing the Wedding Coordinator Rocio who answered all my question & emails very quickly & easily confirmed the date of the wedding.
We did all our wedding plans though Rocio by email
reviews.title: Paradise on Riviera Maya
Enjoyed the Palladium - Three and a half stars by US standards
Nice looking hotel but overall terrible experience !
reviews.text: My Husband and I were married at the Grand Palladium in the Mayan Riveria on May 26th 2005.

My husband and I stayed at the Palladium from May 5 to May 12. Five other family members---two couples and my mother-in-law joined us mid-week. We flew USA 3000 Apple charter direct from BWI to Cancun. Probably because we flew on a weekday, the customs/immigration process wasn’t too long. We paid extra for private travel to the resort. In retrospect, this wasn’t necessary on a Thursday, but might still be a good idea for weekend travel.
reviews.title: Overall, A Great Trip
Kantenah rocks!
reviews.text: The Palladium is breathtakingly beautiful. The landscaping, high ceilings, open-air atmosphere, marble and wood, the pools and beach (more on them later) were all outstanding. We stayed in a standard room (Villa 7, Kantenah side) and had no complaints. We requested this Villa and king sized bed well in advance and got what we asked for. The bathroom was spacious, the mini-bar stocked on schedule, the bed was comfortable, and everything was clean. The only small problem we had was our safe didn’t work at first. After a call to the front desk, someone was over quickly to replace the batteries. Although we had no room issues, our family members staying in Villa 8 did not get their requested King bed, had a non-working key, minor electrical outages, and a flood in their room (which was promptly attended to). We brought a battery-operated travel alarm clock. There are no clocks in the room. Our maid did a great job, and we tipped her about $3.00 per day. A cute towel animal greeted us each day.

The food in our opinion was mediocre. I finally understand how you could be in the midst of a huge buffet but still not find something to eat! There were a lot of fried foods and pasta, which I don’t eat much of. The fruit and salads were all good. We would have preferred a larger selection of seafood. Desserts were tasty. The drink service in the buffet restaurants was a little slow. The coffee was bad. The a la carte restaurants offered a high level of service but the food was still just OK. We ate at the steakhouse, the Mediterranean and the show table at the Japanese restaurant. We had a late reservation (8:30) at the Japanese, and were dismayed that the meal took way too long. We weren’t even served any food until 9:00. Regarding getting sick, my husband and I both got a minor “touch” of stomach troubles on our last day. My mother-in-law and brother-in-law both felt bad for 1-2 days, but no one was seriously ill.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: While we weren’t thrilled with the food, there were no complaints about the drinks. The alcohol was plentiful, and there were always bartenders available to serve anything you wanted. Nothing tasted watered down. The bartender at the spa pool mixes frozen drinks up fresh (no pre-made mix). There were some additional brand label liquors in the a la carte restaurants, but we were surprised that they charge extra in if you want to order wine other than the “house” brand.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect Family Vacation Start to Finish

reviews.text: In the Colonial lobby there are some nice shops and an Internet café. They take only pesos. You can exchange your home currency for pesos at the front desk for a small fee.
reviews.title: Relaxing 10 days at the Palladium

description: The Grand Palladium Kantenah Resort & Spa is located on a spectacular, private Caribbean beach-front complex that boasts of 800 meters of white, fine sand and turquoise blue waters. Guests of the Grand Palladium Kantenah are invited to use the facilities provided by the adjoining Grand Palladium White Sand Resort & Spa, the Grand Palladium Colonial Resort & Spa, and the Grand Palladium Riviera Resort & Spa, with the exception of the Royal Suite facilities.
